data.title: Meoweler Â· Yekaterinburg
data.text:
ð¤

Yekaterinburg can be moderately expensive for tourists, but it is still affordable compared to other Russian cities. The cost of food and accommodation can vary depending on the location and season.

For budget shopping, visit the local markets and try bargaining. Avoid expensive restaurants and opt for street food. Book accommodation in advance for better deals.

Usual visit duration

2-3 days

Transit or for the landmarks

Yekaterinburg is a stopover for Siberia or the Ural Mountains, and visitors usually come to see the Church on the Blood and the Europe-Asia border.

Off the beaten path

â¨ï¸

QWERTY Monument

This quirky symbol of Yekaterinburg's tech scene is a key attraction for curious cats. Be sure to snap a photo before some curious kittens knock the 'keys' over!

Google Maps

ð¤ï¸

Shirokorechenskoe Cemetery

As strange as it may seem, this peaceful cemetery is a favorite for cat-nappers looking for some tranquility, as well as those interested in the history of Yekaterinburg.

Google Maps

ð

Museum of Military Equipment

If you're a history buff, you'll love exploring this museum's collection of tanks, jets, and other military hardware. Get ready to paws for some epic photo ops!

Google Maps

ð¿

Botanical Garden of the Urals Federal University

Purr-se yourself in a lush oasis of over 1800 plant species, including exotic greenhouse specimens. Cats will love the fresh catnip!

Google Maps

ð

Museum of Stone-cutting and Jewelry Art of the Urals

This cat-tivating museum showcases the history of precious stones and jewelry production in the Urals. Purr-haps you'll even discover a new favorite gemstone!

Google Maps
